bibl.title: Egypt in Fourth Century Greek Strategies and Strategical Considerations.
Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011.

bibl.note: Athens, Cyprus and Egypt at the end of the 390s BC. - Chabrias and the Egyptian strategy of Athens in the first half of the fourth century. - Isocrates and the Egyptian strategy. - Chabrias after 360 in Egypt. - Egypt's rôle in the strategic debates at Athens around the middle of the century. - Alexander the Great and the ultimate fourth century strategy for Egypt. - Summary.
bibl.seg: Burkhard Meissner, Egypt in Fourth Century Greek Strategies and Strategical Considerations.

Volker Grieb, Krzysztof Nawotka & Agnieszka Wojciechowska (edd.), Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011 = Philippika. Altertumskundliche Abhandlungen. 74 (Wiesbaden, 2014) pp. 15-27.

Athens, Cyprus and Egypt at the end of the 390s BC. - Chabrias and the Egyptian strategy of Athens in the first half of the fourth century. - Isocrates and the Egyptian strategy. - Chabrias after 360 in Egypt. - Egypt's rôle in the strategic debates at Athens around the middle of the century. - Alexander the Great and the ultimate fourth century strategy for Egypt. - Summary.
